snippet: As Iraq fights the Islamic State, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi is also battling critics in his own party and the Shiite bloc it leads.
abstract: Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq, only a month in office, is battling critics within his own party and the Shiite bloc it leads; political feuding threatens to undermine Iraqi government at moment it is trying to marshal resistance against the Islamic State, not to mention dealing with long list of other domestic crises.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As Iraq fights the Islamic State, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi is also battling critics in his own party and the Shiite bloc it leads.

headline.main: At War Against ISIS, Iraqi Premier Is Facing Battles Closer to Home
headline.print_headline: At War Against Islamic State, Iraqi Premier Is Facing Battles Closer to Home

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
